data.name: Rosalie Moller
data.region: Africa, Egypt, Red Sea Governorate, Qesm Hurghada, Jubal Island
data.description: Dive into a historic WWII shipwreck near Jubal Island in the Red Sea. At depths of 30-50 meters, explore a well-preserved hull teeming with vibrant corals, fish schools, and occasional pelagics. Crystal-clear waters and good visibility make this an exhilarating deep dive for advanced explorers.

data.name: Shab El Fanadir
data.region: Africa, Egypt, Red Sea Governorate, Qesm Hurghada
data.description: A stunning reef wall plunges to 40 meters, teeming with colorful soft corals and vibrant anthias. Schools of barracuda and trevally patrol the blue, while eagle rays glide past. The shallow plateau offers easy diving with abundant marine life. Strong currents sometimes sweep the site, attracting pelagics. Visibility often exceeds 30 meters. Ideal for drift diving and photography.

data.name: Green Hole
data.region: Africa, Egypt, Red Sea Governorate, Qesm Al Qoseir
data.location: Qesm Al Qoseir, Red Sea Governorate
data.description: A deep sinkhole plunging over 50 meters, surrounded by vibrant coral walls teeming with reef sharks, barracuda, and schools of anthias. Strong currents attract pelagics, while the dramatic drop-off creates thrilling drift dives. Excellent visibility and warm waters make it ideal for advanced divers. The site's unique topography offers caves and overhangs to explore. Located near Al Quseir, it's a hidden gem in the Red Sea.

data.name: Million Hope (Wreck)
data.region: Africa, Egypt, Sinai, Sharm El Sheikh
data.description: An intact wreck resting at 30 meters near Sharm El Sheikh, the Million Hope offers an eerie yet fascinating dive. The ship sank in 1996 and now lies on its side, covered in soft corals and surrounded by schools of glassfish. Strong currents sometimes sweep the site, making it ideal for drift diving. Barracuda and trevally patrol the wreck, while moray eels hide in the crevices. The superstructure remains accessible, allowing penetration for advanced divers. Visibility is excellent, often exceeding 30 meters. Best suited for experienced divers due to depth and potential currents.

data.description: Jackson Reef offers dramatic walls plunging into the deep, covered in vibrant soft corals. Schools of barracuda and trevally patrol the blue, while reef sharks often cruise by. Strong currents attract pelagics, making it ideal for drift diving. The plateau teems with colorful anthias and clownfish darting through anemones. Visibility often exceeds 30 meters, with crystal-clear waters showcasing the thriving ecosystem. A thrilling dive for experienced divers.

The site teems with anthias, barracuda, and occasional reef sharks. Strong currents attract pelagics, making it ideal for drift diving. The plateau at 12 meters offers excellent visibility and colorful soft corals. Perfect for intermediate divers seeking dynamic conditions and rich marine encounters.

data.name: Sharm El Rashed South
data.region: Africa, Egypt, Red Sea Governorate, Qesm Safaga
data.description: This site offers vibrant coral gardens and dramatic drop-offs teeming with life. Expect strong currents that attract pelagics like barracuda and reef sharks. The steep walls are covered in soft corals, with overhangs and swim-throughs to explore. Visibility often exceeds 30 meters, making it ideal for photography. The site suits advanced divers due to occasional surge and depth. Night dives reveal nocturnal creatures like octopus and lobster. Nearby pinnacles host schools of anthias and butterflyfish. The warm, clear waters make it a year-round destination.

data.name: Shaab Abu Nugar
data.region: Africa, Egypt, Red Sea Governorate, Qesm Hurghada
data.description: This horseshoe-shaped reef sits in the Red Sea near Hurghada. Strong currents sweep the outer walls, attracting pelagic species like barracuda and reef sharks. Inside, sheltered lagoons host vibrant soft corals and small reef fish. The site drops to 30 meters, offering dramatic wall dives with swim-throughs. Ideal for drift diving, it's best suited for intermediate to advanced divers. Visibility often exceeds 30 meters, showcasing the rich marine ecosystem. The reef top peaks near the surface, allowing deep or shallow exploration. Night dives reveal nocturnal creatures among the coral formations.

data.description: El Fanadir Dacht offers a stunning wall dive with vibrant coral gardens teeming with anthias, lionfish, and occasional reef sharks. The site features dramatic drop-offs and swim-throughs, with excellent visibility year-round. Gentle currents attract schools of barracuda and trevally. Ideal for all skill levels, with depths ranging from 10 to 40 meters. The hard and soft coral formations create a colorful underwater landscape, perfect for photographers. Warm water temperatures make it comfortable for extended dives.

data.name: Thistlegorm
data.region: Africa, Egypt, Sinai, Sharm El Sheikh
data.description: This legendary wreck lies in the Red Sea near Sharm El Sheikh, resting at 30 meters. A WWII cargo ship sunk in 1941, now encrusted with corals and teeming with marine life. Swim through cargo holds filled with trucks, motorcycles, and wartime artifacts. Barracuda, batfish, and lionfish patrol the wreck while moray eels peek from crevices. Strong currents sometimes sweep the site, adding excitement. The shallow deck at 16 meters allows longer bottom time. Perfect for wreck enthusiasts and history buffs.

data.name: El Sayej
data.region: Africa, Egypt, Red Sea Governorate, Qesm Hurghada
data.description: This vibrant reef sits near Hurghada, teeming with colorful soft corals and schools of anthias. The sloping wall drops to 30 meters, offering encounters with turtles, reef sharks, and occasional eagle rays. Strong currents attract pelagics, making it ideal for drift diving. Visibility often exceeds 30 meters, with warm water year-round. The site's healthy coral formations and diverse marine life create an unforgettable underwater spectacle.

data.name: Ras Bob
data.region: Africa, Egypt, Sinai, Sharm El Sheikh
data.ocean: Africa, Egypt, Sinai, Sharm El Sheikh
data.description: Ras Bob offers a stunning wall dive with dramatic drop-offs and vibrant coral gardens. The site teems with reef fish, moray eels, and occasional reef sharks. Strong currents attract pelagic species, making it ideal for drift diving. Visibility often exceeds 30 meters, with clear blue waters. The steep wall plunges deep, creating an exhilarating dive for advanced divers. Coral formations are healthy and diverse, hosting anemones and clownfish. Best dived in calm conditions due to occasional surge. A must for those seeking thrilling underwater terrain and abundant marine life.

data.name: Naama Bay
data.region: Africa, Egypt, Sinai, Sharm El Sheikh
data.description: Naama Bay offers easy shore diving with vibrant coral gardens just steps from the beach. Expect clear waters, gentle currents, and abundant marine life like clownfish, moray eels, and occasional reef sharks. The shallow reefs are perfect for beginners, while deeper sections provide more exploration. Coral formations are healthy, with colorful soft and hard corals. Visibility often exceeds 30 meters. Night dives reveal nocturnal creatures like octopus and lionfish. Convenient access from Sharm El Sheikh makes it a popular spot.

data.region: Africa, Egypt, Red Sea Governorate, Qesm Hurghada
data.description: This dive site features a stunning wall dropping to over 40 meters, covered in vibrant soft corals and sponges. Schools of anthias and fusiliers swirl around the reef, while larger pelagics like barracuda and trevally patrol the blue. The current can be strong, making it ideal for drift diving. Visibility often exceeds 30 meters, revealing the dramatic underwater landscape. The site is known for its rich biodiversity and pristine coral formations.

data.name: Marsa Kharita
data.region: Africa, Egypt, Sinai, Sharm El Sheikh
data.description: This shallow reef near Sharm El Sheikh offers easy diving with vibrant coral gardens and sandy patches. Expect encounters with turtles, moray eels, and schools of colorful reef fish. The gentle slope makes it ideal for beginners, while the clear waters provide excellent visibility. The site often features resting stingrays on the sandy bottom. Night dives reveal nocturnal creatures like octopus and crustaceans. The calm conditions and abundant marine life make it a relaxing yet rewarding dive.

data.description: This dive site off Egypt's Red Sea coast features stunning coral gardens and dramatic drop-offs teeming with life. Schools of barracuda and trevally patrol the blue, while vibrant soft corals cover the reef walls. The site offers excellent visibility year-round, with gentle currents ideal for drift diving. Look for reef sharks in the deeper sections and turtles gliding past the shallower plateaus. The mix of hard and soft corals creates a colorful underwater landscape perfect for photographers. Depths range from 10 to 40 meters, accommodating all experience levels. Night dives reveal a different world of nocturnal creatures emerging from the reef.

data.name: Grand Coral
data.region: Africa, Egypt, Red Sea Governorate, Qesm Safaga
data.description: Dive into a vibrant underwater garden where towering coral formations create a maze of swim-throughs and overhangs. The reef teems with anthias, butterflyfish, and occasional reef sharks patrolling the blue. Strong currents bring nutrient-rich waters, fueling the coral's brilliant colors. Expect excellent visibility and dramatic drop-offs along the reef wall. Night dives reveal nocturnal critters like moray eels and crustaceans. Suitable for all skill levels, with shallow lagoons for beginners and deeper sections for advanced divers. The warm Red Sea waters make this a year-round destination.

data.name: Beacon Reef
data.region: Africa, Egypt, Sinai, Sharm El Sheikh
data.description: Beacon Reef sits just off Sharm El Sheikh in the Red Sea, known for its vibrant coral formations and steep walls. The site features a mix of hard and soft corals teeming with reef fish, moray eels, and occasional reef sharks. Currents can be strong, making it ideal for drift diving. The shallow plateau offers excellent for beginners, while deeper sections challenge advanced divers. Visibility often exceeds 30 meters, with warm water year-round. The reef's pinnacle attracts schooling fish, creating dramatic underwater scenes. Night dives reveal nocturnal creatures like octopus and lionfish.

data.name: White Knight
data.region: Africa, Egypt, Sinai, Sharm El Sheikh
data.ocean: Africa, Egypt, Sinai, Sharm El Sheikh
data.description: This dive site near Sharm El Sheikh features dramatic coral formations and steep walls plunging into the blue. Expect abundant reef fish, moray eels, and occasional pelagics like barracuda. The clear water and mild currents suit all experience levels. Vibrant soft corals cover the reef, especially stunning under natural light. Depths range from shallow reefs to over 30 meters, offering diverse exploration. Night dives reveal nocturnal critters like crustaceans and octopuses. Easy access from shore or boat makes it a reliable choice.

data.name: Bluff Point
data.region: Africa, Egypt, Red Sea Governorate, Qesm Hurghada, Jubal Island
data.description: This site offers dramatic underwater cliffs and steep drop-offs teeming with marine life. Schools of barracuda and trevally patrol the blue, while reef sharks often cruise the depths. The current can be strong, making it ideal for drift diving. Vibrant soft corals and gorgonians cover the walls, with frequent sightings of turtles and eagle rays. Visibility is typically excellent, often exceeding 30 meters. The site suits experienced divers due to depth and currents.

data.name: Nabq
data.region: Africa, Egypt, Sinai, Sharm El Sheikh
data.ocean: Africa, Egypt, Sinai, Sharm El Sheikh
data.description: This shallow reef near Sharm El Sheikh features vibrant coral gardens teeming with colorful fish. The gentle slope makes it ideal for beginners, while the dense marine life keeps advanced divers engaged. Look for moray eels hiding in crevices and schools of anthias dancing above the coral. The calm, clear waters offer excellent visibility year-round, with occasional sightings of turtles and reef sharks. The sandy patches between coral formations host garden eels and stingrays. A relaxed dive with abundant marine diversity.

data.name: Tobia Hamra
data.region: Africa, Egypt, Red Sea Governorate, Qesm Safaga
data.description: This dive site near Safaga features dramatic walls plunging into the deep, covered in vibrant soft corals and sponges. Schools of anthias and fusiliers swirl around the reef, while eagle rays and reef sharks occasionally pass by. The current can be strong, making it ideal for drift diving. The steep drop-offs and overhangs create exciting swim-throughs, with macro life like nudibranchs hiding in the cracks. Visibility often exceeds 30 meters, showcasing the stunning underwater landscape.
